intro: Pterodiscus elliottii, commonly known as the Elliot's pterodiscus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly southern Africa, where it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. The plant is characterized by its broad, palmate leaves and showy, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often found in woodland and savanna habitats, contributing to local biodiversity. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
